newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Engil hits 1996 high, more upside seen.
newsitem.headline: Engil hits 1996 high, more upside seen.

text.p: Construction company Engil-SGPS hit a 1996 high of 1,549 escudos per share on Wednesday, up 89 on the previous close, and although the stock subsequently eased from the peak traders saw more upside.
"It could aim for 1,600 escudos," said one trader who asked not to be named.
Traders said the share had been boosted by a recent road-show in the United States organised by Banco Mello and which included a number of Portuguese firms.
There were also a number of broker buy recommendations out on the stock, they said.
"I think the road-show was pretty important for Engil. It brought some buy orders," said another trader.
"Engil is also the best (Portuguese) company in the sector, given its financial position," he added.
Engil is quoted in New York and Lisbon.
Since the start of the year, the company's stock has risen over 20 percent. It expects to end 1996 with a net profit of 1.5 billion escudos, up from 1.18 billion the previous year.
